snippet: Negotiators for the government and the FARC guerrillas announced their pact, part of broader talks, just a week before a presidential election.
abstract: Negotiators for Colombian government and Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia say they have reached agreement on ways to fight drug trafficking; agreement, which is part of broader talks aimed at ending five decades of war, comes week before presidential election.
lead_paragraph: Negotiators for the government and the FARC guerrillas announced their pact, part of broader talks, just a week before a presidential election.

headline.main: Colombia and Rebels Agree on Drug Fight
headline.print_headline: Colombia and Rebels Agree on Drug Fight
